intro: Atherolepis wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan wallaby's tail, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Atherolepis wallichii is often found in open meadows and along mountain trails at elevations above 2,500 meters.
